channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 4 Best Google Assistant Speakers (2025): Speakers, Displays, Soundbars
item.description: From smart displays to soundbars, Google’s voice assistant comes in all shapes and sizes. Here are our favorites.

item.title: Kevin Hart’s VC firm leads $35M Series B for weight-loss app Simple
item.description: Simple is an AI-powered health coaching app that helps people lose weight.

item.title: Google's Gemini Arrives in Google Home, Alongside New Speaker, Nest Cam, and Nest Doorbell
item.description: Gemini replaces Assistant in your smart home, as Google redesigns the Home app and launches a new generation of Nest devices.

item.title: Petlibro Scout Smart Camera: Filled With Both Features and Kinks
item.description: The pet-tech company’s new AI pet camera promises peace of mind but delivers bugginess and limited use.

item.title: Creative machines and where AI meets imagination at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.description: Discover how AI is co-creating the future of storytelling, video, and animation at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, with Prateek Dixit, Nikola Todorovic, and ...

item.title: Amazon launches a grocery brand with most products under $5
item.description: The Amazon Fresh grocery items will be available online and at Amazon Fresh stores.

item.title: 6 Best Smart Speakers (2025): Alexa, Google Assistant, Siri
item.description: Looking to add a smart speaker to your house so Alexa, Google, or Siri can help you out? Here are the best ones to get.

item.title: Deta’s Surf app is an amalgamation of an AI browser and NotebookLM
item.description: A startup called Deta is releasing a new app called Surf, which is a remix of an AI browser and NotebookLM

item.title: 15 Best Coolers WIRED Tested for Every Budget, Any Situation (2025)
item.description: We chugged chilled beverages to bring you our favorite coolers for every situation.

item.title: UK government tries again to access encrypted Apple customer data: report
item.description: The U.K. Home Office is seeking access to Apple users’ encrypted iCloud backups for a second time, after an earlier attempt failed earlier this year.
